name: Japanese Beef Stir-Fry
author: Campbell's Kitchen
summary: Tender beef strips are quickly stir-fried with crisp and colorful vegetables to make this delicious restaurant-style dinner in your own kitchen.
ingredients: 2 pounds boneless beef sirloin or beef top round steaks (3/4" thick)
1 (10.5 ounce) can  Campbell's® Condensed Beef Broth
1 head Chinese cabbage (bok choy), thinly sliced
2 medium red peppers, cut into 2"-long strips
2 medium green onions, cut into 2" pieces
Hot cooked regular long-grain white rice
directions: Slice beef into very thin strips
Mix cornstarch, broth, soy and sugar until smooth
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in saucepot or wok over high heat
Add beef in 2 batches and stir-fry until browned
Add the mushrooms, cabbage, peppers, celery and green onions in 2 batches and stir-fry over medium heat until tender-crisp
Cook until mixture boils and thickens, stirring constantly
Return beef and vegetables to saucepot and heat through
